title: ESG exclusive 'club' puts pressure on agriculture - AgUpdate
summary: The article discusses the implications of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) criteria on agricultural producers, highlighting the subjective nature of ESG scores, their impact on farming practices, and the pressure on companies to comply with these standards. It explains how agricultural practices are scrutinized under ESG metrics and potentially face unfavorable market consequences based on their environmental performance. The text also references the growing concern about the influence of ESG on farming decisions amid calls for technology integration to improve sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article relates to green innovation as it discusses how agricultural practices and processes need to adapt to ESG standards that promote environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article reflects business innovation because it highlights how farmers and agricultural businesses must innovate their practices and processes to align with ESG criteria, thus differing from traditional methods.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not specifically mention any green product; it focuses more on standards and practices related to farming rather than a specific product.
green_process: TRUE: The article discusses the need for agricultural processes to minimize environmental impacts and adapt to ESG standards, thereby categorizing them as green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111 - Crop Production, 112 - Animal Production, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services, 924120 - Waste Management and Remediation Services
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as it discusses legitimate environmental concerns regarding ESG standards and their impact on agricultural practices rather than misleading consumers about environmental benefits.

title: Koch Engineered Solutions and Percepto Join Forces To Bring - CSRwire.com
summary: Koch Engineered Solutions and Percepto have partnered to leverage AI and autonomous drone technology to aid industrial customers in monitoring and reducing emissions. This collaboration aims to improve service offerings, streamline compliance, reduce operational costs, and enhance safety for industrial facilities. The partnership facilitates better visibility for Percepto among larger clients, while also providing KES with innovative solutions for its customers. This initiative represents a step towards optimizing operations and achieving environmental goals.
green_innovation: TRUE - The innovation involves the use of AI and autonomous drones to monitor and reduce emissions in industrial settings, contributing to environmental sustainability and compliance with emissions regulations.
business_innovation: TRUE - The partnership and the introduction of new services utilizing advanced technology significantly differ from KES's previous offerings, qualifying it as a business innovation.
green_product: FALSE - The article does not specifically define a good or service that meets the characteristics of a green product; it focuses on services utilizing technology rather than a tangible product.
green_process: TRUE - The use of AI and drone technology for emissions monitoring qualifies as a green process, as it aims to minimize environmental impacts in industrial operations.
product_or_process: Percepto Air Max™ and Percepto Air Max OGI™
likely_naics_codes: ['541612 - Human Resources Consulting Services', '541330 - Engineering Services', '334515 - Instrument Manufacturing for Measuring and Testing Electricity and Electrical Signals', '541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services']
greenwashing: FALSE - There is no indication of misleading or exaggerated claims regarding the environmental benefits of the partnership or technology; the focus is on genuine efforts to reduce emissions.

title: ADM invests over $30m in new facility in Spain to meet growing demand for probiotics - FeedNavigator.com
summary: ADM is investing over $30 million to build a facility that will significantly increase its production capacity for probiotics and postbiotics. This new site aims to supply the growing markets for these products in the US, Asia-Pacific, and Europe, with the goal of increasing health and wellness revenue to $2 billion within ten years. The facility is located near an R&D center focused on enhancing animal resilience and health through better nutrition and understanding the gut microbiome.
green_innovation: TRUE: This innovation involves the production of probiotics and postbiotics, which contribute to animal health and well-being while promoting sustainable animal nutrition.
business_innovation: TRUE: The facility represents a significant investment in expanding production capabilities for a new and improved product line aimed at meeting growing market demands.
green_product: TRUE: Probiotics and postbiotics are designed to enhance health and reduce environmental impact associated with animal production.
green_process: TRUE: The facility incorporates sustainable production processes that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote resilience in animal farming.
likely_naics_codes: [{'code': '311990', 'category': 'All Other Food Manufacturing'}, {'code': '325411', 'category': 'Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing'}, {'code': '311113', 'category': 'Sugar and Confectionery Product Manufacturing'}, {'code': '424490', 'category': 'Other Grocery and Related Products Merchant Wholesalers'}]
greenwashing: FALSE: The article focuses on genuine innovations and investments aimed at environmental sustainability and animal health, rather than making misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: Here's what won’t be included in Nassimi’s performance fabrics - Home Accents Today
summary: Textile manufacturer Nassimi has successfully eliminated all PFAS chemicals from its new production, ensuring its fabrics remain environmentally friendly while maintaining performance capabilities. The company has long been committed to sustainable manufacturing practices, having previously developed PFAS-free alternatives. Nassimi's products, including the Supreen performance upholstery fabric, use innovative finishing processes to offer high stain and liquid resistance without harmful chemicals. Their recent reforms culminated in a fully sustainable product portfolio, exemplifying their commitment to environmental stewardship.
green_innovation: TRUE - This is green innovation because Nassimi has eradicated harmful PFAS chemicals from its products, contributing to environmental sustainability and reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE - This is a business innovation because Nassimi has developed a new product portfolio that is significantly different from their previous offerings, introduced PFAS-free alternatives, and brought these innovative products to market.
green_product: TRUE - It is a green product because Nassimi's fabrics are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce environmental impact by eliminating harmful PFAS chemicals and using sustainable materials and processes.
green_process: TRUE - This is a green process as Nassimi employs manufacturing techniques that minimize environmental impact by not using harmful substances and maintaining sustainability throughout the production process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 314110 - Carpet and Rug Mills, 313210 - Broadwoven Fabric Mills, 313220 - Narrow Fabric Mills, 314190 - Other Textile Product Mills
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not describe greenwashing as it presents clear, factual information about Nassimi's sustainable practices and their commitment to eliminating harmful chemicals from their products without misleading claims.

title: Krill diet fulfills choline requirements and supports better intestinal and liver health in salmon - Aquafeed.com
summary: A study conducted by Aker BioMarine and the Norwegian University of Life Sciences evaluated the effects of phosphatidylcholine from krill on reducing intestinal steatosis in Atlantic salmon. The study demonstrated that both krill meal and krill oil effectively reduce fat accumulation in the intestines and support fish growth, suggesting their potential as functional ingredients in fish feed. The findings highlight the nutritional benefits of krill-based diets in aquaculture, with positive implications for fish health and product quality.
green_innovation: TRUE - This innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by improving the aquaculture feed quality, enhancing fish health, and potentially leading to more efficient and sustainable fish farming practices.
business_innovation: TRUE - The introduction of krill meal and krill oil as effective dietary supplements for salmon represents a new or improved product that enhances feeding practices in aquaculture.
green_product: TRUE - Krill meal and krill oil qualify as green products as they are designed to significantly reduce environmental impacts by promoting fish health and efficient nutrient use in aquaculture.
green_process: FALSE - The article does not describe a specific manufacturing or production process that minimizes environmental impacts, as it focuses more on the product and its effects.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311119 - Other Animal Food Manufacturing, 112511 - Finfish Farming and Fish Hatcheries, 541714 - Research and Development in Biotechnology (except Nanobiotechnology), 325412 - Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not contain misleading claims about environmental benefits; it discusses a legitimate research study showcasing the nutritional benefits of krill products in aquaculture.

title: MSD Animal Health set to launch revamped platform to predict poultry health, prevent disease and improve performance - FeedNavigator.com
summary: MSD Animal Health is rolling out SenseHub Poultry in the UK, Brazil, and US poultry markets to enhance health monitoring for poultry farmers. The platform uses wireless sensors to track health and environmental indicators, allowing for early disease detection and improved flock management. This technology aims to increase bird health and operational efficiency. Feedback from global poultry experts has shaped the platform to ensure it meets customer needs.
green_innovation: TRUE. The innovation contributes to environmental sustainability by enabling farmers to monitor key health and environmental indicators, potentially leading to reduced waste and increased efficiency in poultry operations.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of SenseHub Poultry represents a significant improvement in animal health monitoring technology, enhancing MSD Animal Health's offerings and complementing their vaccine portfolio.
green_product: FALSE. While SenseHub Poultry enhances monitoring and health outcomes, it is primarily a technology platform and does not meet the criteria for a green product, which refers specifically to goods or services designed to reduce environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. The use of sensors and analytics to monitor environmental parameters in poultry operations minimizes waste and promotes sustainability, fitting the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325414 - Biological Product (except Diagnostic) Manufacturing, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology), 112320 - Broilers and Other Meat Type Chicken Production, 541511 - Custom Computer Programming Services
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not indicate any misleading claims about environmental benefits; rather, it outlines the genuine technological advancements aimed at improving poultry health and operational efficiency.

title: Top 20 Most Promising Biotechnology Companies In India 2023 - Inventiva
summary: The article lists the top 20 biotechnology companies in India for 2023, highlighting their roles in research, development, and commercialization of biotechnological products and services. These companies are engaged in producing vaccines, biopharmaceuticals, and medical devices, contributing to both domestic and global markets. The article emphasizes their commitment to innovation, quality, and improving healthcare outcomes worldwide. Additionally, it discusses the broader growth of the biotechnology sector in India.
